#T_SP=webanno.custom.Referent|entity|infstat
#T_RL=webanno.custom.Coref|type|BT_webanno.custom.Referent
#Text=A REVELATION
#Text=A group of boys was assembled in an open field to the west of the public schoolhouse in the town of Crawford .
#Text=Most of them held hats in their hands , while two , stationed sixty feet distant from each other , were “ having catch . ”
#Text=Tom Pinkerton , son of Deacon Pinkerton , had just returned from Brooklyn , and while there had witnessed a match game between two professional clubs .

#Text=On his return he proposed that the boys of Crawford should establish a club , to be known as the Excelsior Club of Crawford , to play among themselves , and on suitable occasions to challenge clubs belonging to other villages .
#Text=This proposal was received with instant approval .
#Text=“ I move that Tom Pinkerton address the meeting , ” said one boy .
#Text=“ Second the motion , ” said another .
#Text=As there was no chairman , James Briggs was appointed to that position , and put the motion , which was unanimously carried .
#Text=Tom Pinkerton , in his own estimation a personage of considerable importance , came forward in a consequential manner , and commenced as follows :
#Text=“ Mr. Chairman and boys .
#Text=You all know what has brought us together .
#Text=We want to start a club for playing baseball , like the big clubs they have in Brooklyn and New York . ”
#Text=“ How shall we do it ? ” asked Henry Scott .
#Text=“ We must first appoint a captain of the club , who will have power to assign the members to their different positions .
#Text=Of course you will want one that understands about these matters . ”
#Text=“ He means himself , ” whispered Henry Scott , to his next neighbor ; and here he was right .
#Text=“ Is that all ? ” asked Sam Pomeroy .

#Text=“ No ; as there will be some expenses , there must be a treasurer to receive and take care of the funds , and we shall need a secretary to keep the records of the club , and write and answer challenges . ”
#Text=“ Boys , ” said the chairman , “ you have heard Tom Pinkerton ’s remarks .
#Text=Those who are in favor of organizing a club on this plan will please signify it in the usual way . ”
#Text=All the boys raised their hands , and it was declared a vote .
#Text=“ You will bring in your votes for captain , ” said the chairman .
#Text=Tom Pinkerton drew a little apart with a conscious look , as he supposed , of course , that no one but himself would be thought of as leader .
#Text=Slips of paper were passed around , and the boys began to prepare their ballots .
#Text=They were brought to the chairman in a hat , and he forthwith took them out and began to count them .
#Text=“ Boys , ” he announced , amid a universal stillness , “ there is one vote for Sam Pomeroy , one for Eugene Morton , and the rest are for Frank Fowler , who is elected . ”
#Text=There was a clapping of hands , in which Tom Pinkerton did not join .
#Text=Frank Fowler , who is to be our hero , came forward a little , and spoke modestly as follows :
#Text=“ Boys , I thank you for electing me captain of the club . I am afraid I am not very well qualified for the place , but I will do as well as I can . ”
#Text=The speaker was a boy of fourteen .
#Text=He was of medium height for his age , strong and sturdy in build , and with a frank prepossessing countenance , and an open , cordial manner , which made him a general favorite .

#Text=It was not , however , to his popularity that he owed his election , but to the fact that both at bat and in the field he excelled all the boys , and therefore was the best suited to take the lead .
#Text=The boys now proceeded to make choice of a treasurer and secretary .
#Text=For the first position Tom Pinkerton received a majority of the votes .
#Text=Though not popular , it was felt that some office was due him .
#Text=For secretary , Ike Stanton , who excelled in penmanship , was elected , and thus all the offices were filled .
#Text=The boys now crowded around Frank Fowler , with petitions for such places as they desired .
#Text=“ I hope you will give me a little time before I decide about positions , boys , ” Frank said ;
#Text=“ I want to consider a little . ”
#Text=“ All right !
#Text=Take till next week , ” said one and another , “ and let us have a scrub game this afternoon . ”
#Text=The boys were in the middle of the sixth inning , when some one called out to Frank Fowler : “ Frank , your sister is running across the field .
#Text=I think she wants you . ”
#Text=Frank dropped his bat and hastened to meet his sister .
#Text=“ What ’s the matter , Gracie ? ” he asked in alarm .
#Text=“ Oh , Frank ! ” she exclaimed , bursting into tears .
#Text=“ Mother ’s been bleeding at the lungs , and she looks so white .
#Text=I ’m afraid she ’s very sick . ”
#Text=“ Boys , ” said Frank , turning to his companions , “ I must go home at once .
#Text=You can get some one to take my place , my mother is very sick . ”
#Text=When Frank reached the little brown cottage which he called home , he found his mother in an exhausted state reclining on the bed .
#Text=“ How do you feel , mother ?
#Text=” asked our hero , anxiously .
#Text=“ Quite weak , Frank , ” she answered in a low voice .
#Text=“ I have had a severe attack . ”
#Text=“ Let me go for the doctor , mother . ”
#Text=“ I do n’t think it will be necessary , Frank .
#Text=The attack is over , and I need no medicines , only time to bring back my strength . ”
#Text=But three days passed , and Mrs. Fowler ’s nervous prostration continued .
#Text=She had attacks previously from which she rallied sooner , and her present weakness induced serious misgivings as to whether she would ever recover .
#Text=Frank thought that her eyes followed him with more than ordinary anxiety , and after convincing himself that this was the case , he drew near his mother ’s bedside , and inquired :
